error/false/to extort

definition: error in a text/text corruption
variant Chinese character
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
Yupian, Chinese dictionary compiled by Gu Yewang 顧野王|顾野王[Gu4 Ye3 wang2] in 6th century AD

Longkan Shoujian, Chinese character dictionary from 997 AD containing 26,430 entries, with radicals placed into 240 rhyme groups and arranged according to the four tones, and the rest of the characters similarly arranged under each radical
see 龍龕手鑑|龙龛手鉴[Long2 kan1 Shou3 jian4]
original form of a Chinese character
character book (i.e. school primer)
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
Leipian, Chinese character dictionary with 31,319 entries, compiled by Sima Guang 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] et al in 11th century
omission/missing word
to explain/to interpret/interpretation
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
